title: JSON schema for SKY UX CLI skyuxconfig.json

url.description: Fully qualified URL of the file.

head.description: Inject in the head versus before the closing body tag.

a11y.description: Enables or disables accessibility test rules. You can manage rules individually, or you can enable or disable all rules in bulk.

app.description: Specifies configuration options for the local app when running skyux serve

title.description: Controls the page title at the template level while waiting for the application to load.

port.description: Configures a port for the skyux serve command to use. If no port is specified, skyux serve dynamically finds an available port.

externals.description: Dynamically injects CSS and JavaScript files into SKY UX Host. You should have a specific use-case for an externals and they must be white-listed by the SKY UX team.

before.description: CSS files to inject before default SKY UX files.

after.description: CSS files to inject after default SKY UX files.

before.description: JS files to inject before default SKY UX files.

after.description: JS files to inject before default SKY UX files.

appSettings.description: Specifies data that is available for reuse throughout the application.

auth.description: Indicates whether the application requires an authenticated Blackbaud ID

codeCoverageThreshold.description: Specifies the minimum required code coverage threshold.

compileMode.description: Specifies how to compile the project's code.

cssPath.description: Specifies a path to reference CSS styles. This property is specific to the SKY UX docs site and is for internal Blackbaud use only.

help.description: Indicates whether to automatically include the help widget in the application to identify the current page and display relevant help content. This property is for internal Blackbaud use only.

host.description: Specifies configuration options for communication with SKY UX Host.

url.description: Specifies a base URL to pass information from skyux serve to the SKY UX Host.

importPath.description: Specifies a path to reference SKY UX components in Angular. This property is specific to the SKY UX docs site and is for internal Blackbaud use only.

mode.description: Controls how much boilerplate code to generate automatically.

name.description: Specifies the name of the project when running in SKY UX Host. By default, SKY UX Builder uses the name property in the package.json file, minus the 'blackbaud-skyux-spa-' prefix.

omnibar.description: Specifies an object to pass to the omnibar's load method. This property is for internal Blackbaud use only.

experimental.description: Whether to display the new 'experimental' Omnibar or the traditional one.

params.description: Specifies a list of parameters that are allowed at runtime.

required.description: Indicates the parameter must be supplied to the application in order to function.

value.description: The default value of the parameter. This value may be overridden at runtime by the query string or other future sources of parameter values.

excludeFromRequests.description: Indicates whether the parameter should be excluded from the parameters automatically added to the query string of URLs requested with SkyAuthHttp.

plugins.description: Specifies plugins to expand on existing SKY UX Builder functionality and create new functionality.

redirects.description: Specifies redirects for pages within an application using from : to pattern.

routes.description: Allows you to use the omnibar but still define navigation items. This property is for internal Blackbaud use only.

useHashRouting.description: Allows your SPA to use Angular's hash location strategy.

skyuxModules.description: The individual SKY UX modules that should be imported into the application.  Use this property for performance optimization when your application only uses a small subset of SKY UX components.

e2e.description: Test settings specific to the skyux e2e command.

browserSet.description: The named set of browsers to run against.

unit.description: Test settings specific to the skyux test command.

browserSet.description: The named set of browsers to run against.
